name: Berserker
desc: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end--that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

name: Lore
desc: Bards of the College of Lore know something about most things, collecting bits of knowledge from sources as diverse as scholarly tomes and peasant tales. Whether singing folk ballads in taverns or elaborate compositions in royal courts, these bards use their gifts to hold audiences spellbound. When the applause dies down, the audience members might find themselves questioning everything they held to be true, from their faith in the priesthood of the local temple to their loyalty to the king. The loyalty of these bards lies in the pursuit of beauty and truth, not in fealty to a monarch or following the tenets of a deity. A noble who keeps such a bard as a herald or advisor knows that the bard would rather be honest than politic. The college's members gather in libraries and sometimes in actual colleges, complete with classrooms and dormitories, to share their lore with one another. They also meet at festivals or affairs of state, where they can expose corruption, unravel lies, and poke fun at self-important figures of authority.

name: Life
desc: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy--one of the fundamental forces of the universe--that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need, and driving away the forces of death and undeath. Almost any non-evil deity can claim influence over this domain, particularly agricultural deities, sun gods, gods of healing or endurance, and gods of home and community.

name: Land
desc: The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition. These druids meet within sacred circles of trees or standing stones to whisper primal secrets in Druidic. The circle's wisest members preside as the chief priests of communities that hold to the Old Faith and serve as advisors to the rulers of those folk. As a member of this circle, your magic is influenced by the land where you were initiated into the circle's mysterious rites.

name: Champion
desc: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

name: Open Hand
desc: Monks of the Way of the Open Hand are the ultimate masters of martial arts combat, whether armed or unarmed. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents, manipulate ki to heal damage to their bodies, and practice advanced meditation that can protect them from harm.

name: Devotion
desc: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their gods' tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angels--the perfect servants of good--as their ideals, and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.

name: Hunter
desc: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness. As you walk the Hunter's path, you learn specialized techniques for fighting the threats you face, from rampaging ogres and hordes of orcs to towering giants and terrifying dragons.

name: Thief
desc: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.

name: Draconic
desc: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their descent back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might even have claimed a dragon parent. Some of these bloodlines are well established in the world, but most are obscure. Any given sorcerer could be the first of a new bloodline, as a result of a pact or some other exceptional circumstance.

name: Fiend
desc: You have made a pact with a fiend from the lower planes of existence, a being whose aims are evil, even if you strive against those aims. Such beings desire the corruption or destruction of all things, ultimately including you. Fiends powerful enough to forge a pact include demon lords such as Demogorgon, Orcus, Fraz'Urb-luu, and Baphomet; archdevils such as Asmodeus, Dispater, Mephistopheles, and Belial; pit fiends and balors that are especially mighty; and ultroloths and other lords of the yugoloths.

name: Evocation
desc: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful elemental effects such as bitter cold, searing flame, rolling thunder, crackling lightning, and burning acid. Some evokers find employment in military forces, serving as artillery to blast enemy armies from afar. Others use their spectacular power to protect the weak, while some seek their own gain as bandits, adventurers, or aspiring tyrants.

name: Primal Fury
desc: Barbarians who walk the Path of Primal Fury tap into raw elemental forces, channeling them through their rage. Their fury manifests as crackling energy that surrounds them in battle, burning those who dare to strike them. These warriors are said to carry the wrath of nature itself in their hearts.

name: Battle
desc: Bards of the College of Battle are warrior-poets who weave their magic through martial prowess. They train in combat as rigorously as they practice their art, believing that the clash of steel can be as beautiful as any song. These bards inspire their allies not just with words, but by standing beside them in battle, their weapons singing a deadly refrain.

name: Forge
desc: The gods of the forge are patrons of artisans who work with metal, from the humble blacksmith to the mighty weaponsmith. These deities teach that with patience and hard work, even the most base metal can be transformed into something beautiful. Clerics of this domain serve as divine smiths, using their blessings to protect and strengthen their allies' equipment.

name: Lore
desc: The gods of lore - including deities of knowledge, prophecy, and secrets - value learning and understanding above all. Clerics of these deities are scholars and sages who seek to preserve ancient wisdom and uncover forgotten truths. They believe that knowledge is the greatest treasure, and they dedicate themselves to protecting libraries, deciphering ancient texts, and advising rulers with their wisdom.

name: Radiance
desc: The gods of radiance - including sun gods, gods of dawn, and deities of purification - bring light to darkness and cleanse evil with holy fire. Clerics of this domain wield radiant energy and flame as weapons against the undead and forces of darkness. They are beacons of hope in the darkest times, burning away corruption with divine light.

name: Wild
desc: The gods of the wild - including nature deities, beast lords, and primordial spirits - embody the untamed natural world. Clerics of this domain are champions of the wilderness, protecting natural places from those who would exploit them. They command beasts, manipulate plants, and call upon primal forces to defend the wilds.

name: Storm
desc: The gods of storms - including deities of thunder, sea, and sky - command the raw power of nature's fury. Clerics of this domain are avatars of destruction and chaos, wielding lightning and thunder as weapons. They are as unpredictable as the storms they serve, bringing both life-giving rain and devastating tempests.

name: Shadow
desc: The gods of shadow - including deities of secrets, twilight, and hidden knowledge - thrive in darkness and deception. Clerics of this domain are masters of stealth and illusion, moving unseen through the world and manipulating events from the shadows. They understand that sometimes the greatest good is achieved through cunning rather than force.

name: Wildfire
desc: Druids of the Circle of Wildfire understand that destruction is sometimes necessary for new growth. They see fire not as pure devastation, but as a force of renewal - clearing away the old to make way for new life. These druids bond with primal fire spirits, channeling flame not just to burn, but to cleanse and transform.

name: Weapon Master
desc: Fighters who dedicate themselves to the Weapon Master archetype become supreme tacticians and martial artists. They study every angle of attack, every defensive stance, and learn to adapt their fighting style to any situation. Where other fighters might specialize, the Weapon Master thrives through versatility, able to switch between combat techniques as fluidly as breathing.

name: Veil
desc: Monks of the Way of the Veil learn to manipulate perception itself, bending reality around them to confuse and disorient their foes. They move unseen through crowded streets, strike from unexpected angles, and vanish before their enemies can retaliate. These monks believe that the greatest weapon is not strength, but the enemy's own confusion.

name: Retribution
desc: The Oath of Retribution is sworn by paladins who seek to punish wrongdoers and protect the innocent from evil. Unlike the measured justice of Devotion paladins, those who swear this oath believe that evil must be met with overwhelming force. They hunt down villains and tyrants, ensuring that those who harm the innocent face swift and certain punishment.

name: Beastbound
desc: Rangers who follow the Beastbound archetype form deep mystical bonds with animal companions. Unlike mere pet handlers, these rangers share their very life force with their beasts, creating a bond that transcends normal understanding. The ranger and beast move as one, fight as one, and in some cases, even think as one.

name: Shadowblade
desc: Rogues who embrace the Shadowblade archetype are masters of assassination and stealth. They train extensively in the art of the perfect kill, studying anatomy, poison, and timing to strike with lethal precision. These rogues move through darkness like it's a second home, becoming nearly impossible to detect when they don't wish to be seen.

name: Chaos Born
desc: Your magic springs from the raw chaos that exists between the planes of order. Perhaps you were born during a planar convergence, or your ancestor made a deal with a being of pure entropy. Whatever the source, your spells crackle with unpredictable energy, sometimes producing effects even you didn't expect. While other sorcerers seek to control their magic, you've learned to embrace the chaos.

name: Void
desc: Your patron is a being from the spaces between reality - the Void that exists beyond comprehension. These entities hunger for knowledge and secrets, and in exchange for your service, they grant you power over minds and the ability to glimpse hidden truths. Your pact grants you telepathic abilities and protection from those who would harm you, as your patron shields your mind from assault.

name: Foresight
desc: Wizards who study the School of Foresight learn to peer through the veil of time, glimpsing possible futures and manipulating probability itself. These diviners don't just predict what will happen - they shape reality by choosing which futures come to pass. Their magic gives them an uncanny ability to avoid danger and ensure their plans succeed.

name: Doom
desc: Gods of doom oversee fate, divine judgment, and inevitable consequences. Their clerics are prophets who pronounce doom upon the wicked and ensure that destiny runs its course. These doomsayers wield curses and prophecies, enforcing cosmic justice and reminding mortals that all actions have consequences that cannot be escaped.
